page.title: 08Horningsham Village Shop
page.content: Since 1837 there has been a village shop.The shop has been in the Haskells family for the last 17 years.In January 1971 the village Post office was amalgamated with the shop. The shop measures 36 square metres with approximatley three times as much storage space. Mr Haskel opens the shop for 41 and a half hours per week with Mrs Haskel working between 15 and 20 hours.They have part_time help on Thursdays and Fridays which are the two busiest days.there is a delivery service three days a week to elderly people in the village. Over 3,500 different items are sold varying from a mouse_trap to a bottle of champagne.
